alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Eastern Orleans; Lower Jefferson; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 10:24AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ST. BERNARD, SOUTHEASTERN ST. CHARLES, ORLEANS, NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTHWESTERN PLAQUEMINES PARISHES THROUGH 1115 AM CST... At 1023 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Catherine to Chalmette to near Jean Lafitte. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Marrero, Harvey, East New Orleans, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Gretna, Westwego, Jean Lafitte, Lake Catherine, Woodmere, Violet, Terrytown, Meraux, Lafitte, Poydras, Estelle, Shell Beach, and Barataria. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 240 and 241, and between mile markers 243 and 255. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in New Orleans.
